name: SkuContext
description:
Retrieves context of an SKU.
> üìò Onboarding guide 
>
> Check the new [Catalog onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/catalog-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Catalog and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

Content-Type.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

$ul: **AlternateIdValues**: Array with values of alternative SKU IDs.
**AlternateIds**: Array with alternate SKU IDs, such as EAN and RefId.
**Attachments**: Array with Attachments ID that are related to the SKU.
**Categories**: Array with Categories from the related Product.
**Collections**: Array with Collections ID that are related to the Product.
**Dimension**: Object containing the SKU dimensions to be used on the shipping calculation.

**EstimatedDateArrival**: To add the product as pre-sale, enter the product estimated arrival date in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format. You must take into consideration both the launch date and the freight calculation for the arrival date.
**IsActive**: Defines if the SKU is active or not.
**IsGiftCardRecharge**: Defines if the purchase will generate a reward.
**IsKit**: Defines if the SKU is part of a bundle.
**IsProductActive**: Defines if the product is active or not.
**KitItems**: Array with SKU IDs of bundle components.
**NameComplete**: Product Name and SKU Name concatenated.
**ProductIsVisible**: Defines if the product is visible or not.
**ProductRefId**: Reference ID of the related Product.
**RealDimension**: Object containing the real SKU dimensions, which appear in the product page.
**RewardValue**: Reward value related to the SKU.
**SalesChannels**: Array with the ID of all the Sales Channels that are related to the product.
**Services**: Array with Service IDs that are related to the SKU.
**ShowIfNotAvailable**: Defines if the product will be shown if it is not available.
**UnitMultiplier**: This is the multiple number of SKU. If the Multiplier is 5.0000, the product can be added in multiple quantities of 5, 10, 15, 20, onward.
